addressleaf.section:
To the right honorable my singular good Lord the L Burghley, Lord highe Treasuro
r
of England.

8 May
1589
M
r
Bodeley. from
e Haghe.
He commendeth
M
r
Valecke
&
M
r
Loosen
2 of
e [Com
s
] of
e
States
./

page.lettertext:
It may please yo
r
L. so to Welcome M
r
Loosen and M
r
Valcke, as they may partly
perce ave, that yo
r
L. will doe it, in regard
of my writing. For though
e self same stream
hath caried them w
t
e rest, in their publicke
consultations, yet their dealing hath bin
ever more moderat, and in particular to me
very loving and kinde. I doe assure my
self, that they are enjoined in this voiage, to
deale in divers causes, against their owne
proper judgements: as yo
r
L. shall perceave
by
e maneging of their buisnes. But yet
they will not seeme to disunite themselves, or
hasarde
e losse of their lodging in
Holland
I doe not name
Mons
r
Egmond
, though he
beare
e first place in Commission: for that
I finde him one of
e worst affected persons
in this contrey, against
e Englishe nation.
For whiche I recommend
e other two to yo
r
L. and take my humble leave.
From
e Hage. May 8. 1589.
Yo
r
L. most humbly bounden Tho. Bodley
